title: 'These dogs save people's lives': inside The Dog House, the most charming – and emotional – show on TV
text:
The most heartwarming TV show on air right now isn’t a baking or ballroom contest. Neither is it a cosy drama or romantic comedy. It’s a waggy-tailed, wet-nosed reality series on Channel 4.

The Dog House is set inside Wood Green, The Animals Charity in rural Cambridgeshire, where staff are committed to matching their homeless dogs with hopeful owners. Like The Undateables meets Paul O’Grady: For The Love Of Dogs, this is speed-dating on four paws, following people who want to open up their lives to a new furry friend.

At a time when it’s rainy and ranty in the outside world, The Dog House is the ideal televisual tonic. A comforting balm for the soul. Although, a warning for the uninitiated:...
description: The most heartwarming TV show on air right now isn’t a baking or ballroom contest.
